intro: Turritis canadensis, commonly known as Canadian turritis, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish flowers. Turritis canadensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
